job_title: Undergraduate Admissions Ambassador in Reading, PA
pros: Flexible hours, good staff, fun environment
cons: Few hours and low pay

review_title: Not what you think it is…
pros: It is a very nice, small campus. A lot of people are helpful and pleasant to work with.
cons: If you are not an Alum, you probably won’t fit in at this College. IMO, the expectations of the Administration are unrealistic and not prioritized. Asking for prioritization will not help either. The Administration is unwilling to set work priorities when asked. It is unfortunate because the College has a ton of potential. The College is currently out of compliance with the MSCHE requirements of Affiliation and some other standards. When I approach the Administration about these concerns there was no actionable response.

pros: Zero, nothing positive. So full of themselves and ignore themission.
cons: Bad leadership, horrible provost. All about themselves.

review_title: Lower than most pay, like most other part time faculty jobs.
pros: None. When you create a course from nothing, after being misled that they might hire you again in the future, it's hard to find anything positive.
cons: Low pay, misleading management who tells you, when they hire you, that this could be a continuing part time job. Then near the end of the semester, after you receive good reviews from the students and ask if you can teach there in the future, you're told this was a one time replacement for a full time tenured professor who went on a 1 semester sabbatical. So, maybe when that professor goes on sabbatical again in 5 more years I might be able to go back and make use of all that time I put into developing the course from nothing? All I was provided with was a syllabus from a prior semester. I created the entire course content from nothing, only to never make use of that material again.

job_title: Auxiliary Public Safety Officer in Reading, PA
pros: flexible schedule and easy job
cons: low pay and poor management

job_title: Recording Studio Manager in Reading, PA
pros: This is a great learning experience
cons: low compensation and a high workload

job_title: Student Account Representative in Reading, PA
pros: Helping students achieve their dream of earning a college education.
cons: Position required a bachelor’s degree however paid poorly. Difficult to sell the dream that a degree is worth the time and monetary investment when the College values college educated positions so poorly.

review_title: Convenient Student Job at Albright College
pros:
Very flexible work hours. 
Frequent and optional opportunities for more hours than what was signed up for
Allows an easy balance between school work and company responsibilities 
Clean environment that is frequently sanitized
Friendly and professional coworkers
cons:
Absolute minimum wage is paid
Promotion Student Coordinator is a mere ten extra cents to the hourly wage
Equipment can be somewhat unreliable and prone to malfunction at times
Mandatory over night shifts, which must be worked at least twice per semester

job_title: Director of the Fund for Albright in Reading, PA
pros: Family oriented and close knit
cons: Limited staffing so shops are sometimes stretched thin

job_title: Auxiliary Public Safety Officer in Reading, PA
pros: Benefits were an aspect of employment
cons: Management was poor and they did not respect the Public Safety department

review_title: RA Job is a good work experience that pays
job_title: Student Resident Assistant in Reading, PA
pros:
Fully covered housing costs
Job experience
Customer service practice
Broadens your skill set
Build Rewarding relationships/connections with students and staff
cons:
There are a lot of responsibilities
Can be stressful

pros: Good experience and good leadership skills
cons: I get little pay due to minimum wage

pros: Great professors, Wonderful classes, Individualized Help
cons: Pricey Tuition, Small campus, Older Buildings

review_title: Opportunities and frustrations on a quaint campus
pros: The first thing that pops into my mind is the students.  Most are highly motivated, although with a real range of backgrounds and aptitudes that can sometimes be a challenge.  It's a cute little compact campus and I had great relationships with the support staff I worked with there.  Administratively, they are open to trying out new things, such as experimental courses, etc.  I also liked was that the school had a commitment to service as part of its mission, which was reflected in student involvement and other opportunities.  It's a small liberal arts college... you can get to know your colleagues fairly easily and I enjoyed contacts with faculty from other departments.
cons: They seem to have no money, or they didn't when I was there, despite high tuition fees.  The lack of funding was very visible in my department and in physical aspects of parts of the buildings.  Also, the vast range in aptitudes of the students can pose problems for instructors.

pros: Employees/employers are great. Flexible work hours.
cons: Very low pay. $7.25 With no bonuses or raises.

review_title: Far from perfect but I would do it all again.
pros: When you work for Albright, you're there for the people and the atmosphere. Very easy to develop a "work-family" here because faculty and staff is extremely welcoming and rather social. Definite opportunities to gain valued experience but room for growth is sparse.
cons: Several understaffed departments and communication issues between departments make simple inter-departmental tasks much more more complicated. Serious budgeting issues which leads to high tuition rates (meaning unhappy parents and students), a lack of small but necessary improvements (unhappy everyone else), and constant pushing for more fundraising efforts.

review_title: Loved every second of working there.
pros: Staff and teachers are all incredibly helpful. There is a close-knit relationship between the faculty and if you ever run into a problem there are a number of people that will be there to help and support you. Working with the students is also incredibly satisfying.
cons:
Human Resources can be a pain to work with. Getting things achieved at a higher level was usually a waiting game and often concerns or requests were overlooked particularly by upper management.
As a student, upon graduation most job offers or your current position is likely to be revoked. It is very difficult to maintain a job here post-graduation.

review_title: A Tightly-knit community with lots of opportunity and changes to grow. It is what you make it.
pros: Service Excellence, small community with generally great people (though there's always a few exceptions), beautiful and historic campus
cons: Currently facing budget concerns, not always the best communication between departments

pros: SOME of the people are great to work with.  And every other department seems fine.
cons: They put on a bright, cheery exterior downstairs...but upstairs and behind closed doors is a whole different story.  They will get rid of you in a hot second with no warning and for no reason.  After my ousting, I was told this dept.  has a HABIT of getting rid of people on a whim because the hormonal second floor can't handle someone who may be better than they are!!  Or just as good.  Or has their own ides!!  It's a sad situation!

pros: The best reason to work here is the people that continually make Albright great. There is room for innovation, growth, and the opportunity to support a truly rigorous classroom environment that enriches the lives of it's students.
cons: Demanding schedule and juggling multiple projects. All hands are on deck!

review_title: Albright College - Only if it's your only offer.
pros: Good people working in the trenches; great students.
cons: Salaries lower than market.  Elitist Attitude.  Administrative policies and procedures do not follow faculty handbook.  Department leadership is different across the board.  Administrators not formally trained to manage....they flounder and struggle to get by.

pros: The student population is small and family like.
cons:
Horrible HR department
Get rid of people with no warnings
Allow some departments a high turnover rate
Low pay for amount of work that heap on you

pros: It is an amazing opportunity to help others learn.
cons: Adjuncts are paid very unfairly. It is less than minimum wage when considering all the time that is spent outside of the classroom preparing for classes, correcting papers and exams, and responding to student's emails and questions about the subject.

pros: Albright College features collegial faculty, excellent staff, and supportive administration. The tight knit community gives the students amazing potential to succeed.
cons: Classroom requirements and requests are occasionally unaccommodated however, the new facilities and renovations will assist in remedying these small issues.

review_title: Great people with great personalities allow their students to act as a "face" of the college while promoting it.
pros: Family oriented atmosphere keeps you wanting to go in day after day while meeting new people from all over the country and world.
cons: Can be monotonous when having to "file" and no one likes to do things like give tours when the weather is bad outside.

pros: Co-workers are very friendly, and it is a welcoming place.  The students are overwhelmingly nice and earnest, befitting of an institution with such a large community of first in family to go to college.
cons: The demographics are working against the college, and years of deferred maintenance have caught up, financially.

review_title: Overall great working environment with awesome staff at the library.
pros:
Great staff and friendly environment.
small campus so you got to know many people and students
cons: no pay raise for the 2 years i worked there, i was a student but with the time, and experience they did not give a raise at all.

review_title: Not a place you want to work at for multiple years
pros: Generous retirement plan, ample vacation
cons: Salary far below market value, negative atmosphere among staff, decaying infrastructure and lack of leadership

review_title: A bad time to work in higher ed!
pros: Great sense of community and charity!
cons: Poor money management by administration. Seemingly empty promises to staff and faculty. Terrible injustice to such dedicated employees!

pros: Diverse clients, international environment, worked on communications and writing skills.
cons: Location of college in sketchy area; however proper security was provided.

pros: Pretty much unlimited budget during travel season.
cons: Hostile work environment, passive aggressive employees, many late nights and weekends, poor training, unorganized, no positive feedback ever

cons: Parking an issue, Long days/weekends

going
